summary: This document is an email chain from November 27, 2019, forwarding information from a European publication to FBI case agents in New York. The publication claims to have a passenger list from Jeffrey Epstein's private plane from 1996-1997 and offers to put the FBI in contact with a female passenger.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure; the document concerns his private plane and the FBI's interest in speaking to its passengers.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: An FBI agent in New York (NYOC) who received the initial phone call and email about Epstein's plane passenger information.

events.title: Epstein Plane Flights
events.description: A female was reportedly a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane multiple times.

events.title: Epstein Plane Flights
events.description: A female was reportedly a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane multiple times.

events.title: Information Offer to FBI
events.description: A European publication contacts the FBI's New York office, offering a passenger list from Epstein's plane and contact with a female passenger.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York (FBI New York Division)
keyFacts: A European publication contacted the FBI on November 27, 2019, claiming to have a passenger list from Jeffrey Epstein's private plane from 1996-1997.
The publication specifically mentioned a female who was a passenger on the plane multiple times during those years and offered to provide her contact information.
The FBI's New York Office (NYOC) received this information and forwarded it to case agents, indicating ongoing investigative interest in Epstein's plane passengers.
